intro: Ditassa schlechteri, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and often toxic species. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with five petals and a hairy, glandular stem. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often have a waxy coating.
